intro: Larysacanthus ciliatus, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and hairy, silver-green leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Larysacanthus ciliatus is adapted to withstand high temperatures and drought, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
